thread.title: Early turnovers doom Chino Valley football
thread.title_full: Early turnovers doom Chino Valley football

title: Early turnovers doom Chino Valley football
text: Early turnovers doom Chino Valley football Troy Weigel/For the ReviewChino Valley�s Justin Ward, #19,breaks a tackle from Paradise Honors� Josh Essegian for an 81 yard kickoff return. Chino Valley took on Paradise Honors Friday night, October 9th, at Chino Valley. Ken Sain Associate Editor Chino Valley High School senior Justin Ward was a frustrated kick returner last season, football coach Wade Krug said."We've been telling him, he's going to break it, he's going to break it," Krug said. "He had one called back earlier this season, and this one he hit the seam and just went."Ward's fourth quarter 81-yard kickoff return was one of the few highlights in Friday's 41-14 loss to Paradise Honors of Surprise in a Section III game. Chino Valley falls to 2-5 (0-2 in section) and Paradise Honors improves to 5-2 (1-1)."Last year I was a little frustrated by it, but coach kept me in high spirits," Ward said.Paradise Honors jumped out to a 14-0 lead before Chino Valley had run its fourth offensive play of the game. It could have been worse, the Panthers missed a 47-yard field goal attempt in that span. The culprit was turnovers.The Panthers took the opening kickoff and scored after a 12-play drive. Chino Valley then tossed an interception on its third offensive play, giving Paradise Honors the ball at the Cougar 15. Three plays later it was a two touchdown deficit.On Chino Valley's next offensive play, they fumbled on a handoff attempt, giving the Panthers the ball at the Cougars' 20."This is not typical, we've been really good, especially the last three weeks, we've been really good on ball security," Krug said. "And all of a sudden this game it just jumped up and bit us."It was a tough night for Chino Valley quarterback Josh Fisher, who completed three of 14 passes for 44 yards but threw four interceptions. The Cougars turned the ball over five times in the game.Paradise Honors increased its lead to 21-0 at halftime, and then 35-0 just after the fourth quarter started while Chino Valley struggled on offense. The Cougars earned only four first downs in the first three quarters.It was on the kickoff after the Panthers stretched their lead to 35 points that Ward had his big return. He ran down the left sideline, making a key cutback at midfield before he was tackled from behind at the 11."A kid dived for me and knocked me off balance ... caught me by a shoelace so I couldn't take it in," Ward said. "My teammates made a lot of good blocks for me, that's how I was able to break it."Two plays after the return senior Michael Brillhart scored on a 7-yard run, cutting the lead to 35-6 with 10 minutes and 39 seconds to play.The Panthers answered with their final score. Then Chino Valley put together its best offensive series of the night, a 12-play, 63 yard drive that ended with a Josh Fisher to Tyler Gianfrancesco 10-yard touchdown pass. Fisher tossed the two-point conversion pass to Michael Rodriguez for the game's final points with 3:01 to play.Paradise Honors 41, Chino Valley 14Paradise Honors 14 7 7 6--41Chino Valley 0 0 0 14-14PH-Sekou Tyler 1 run (Livingston kick)PH-Jordan Gourley 6 pass to Chris Persons (Livingston kick)PH-Jace Ogorchock 14 run (Livingston kick)PH-Jordan Gourley 1 run (Livingston kick)PH-Sekou Tyler 45 run (Livingston kick)CV-Michael Brillhart 7 run (kick failed)PH-Brandon Brown 15 run (kick failed)CV-Josh Fisher 10 pass to Tyler Gianfrancesco (Fisher to Michael Rodriguez pass)RUSHINGChino Valley: Jerad Chavez 10-39; Josh Fisher 12-39; Michael Brillhart 5-20; Taylor Marshall 3-19; Tyler Gianfrancesco 2-4.PASSINGChino Valley: Josh Fisher 3-14-44-4.RECEIVINGChino Valley: Michael Rodriguez 1-21; Jacob Nelson 1-13; Tyler Gianfrancesco 1-10.
